result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Mark Williamson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc. [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).
  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc. [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Penny Mustard Gallery located at 6800 Industrial Loop, Greendale.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at $150.00 payable to Karl's Catring located at 5100 W. Loomis Road, Greenfield.  Restitution to collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid prior to court costs, surcharges and assessments.
Concurrent with: concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent Mark Williamson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (49 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing 08-25-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 1/2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with Penny Mustard Gallery located at 6800 Industrial Loop, Greendale
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 1/2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $150.00 payable to Karl's Catring located at 5100 W. Loomis Road, Greenfield.  Restitution to collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid prior to court costs, surcharges and assessments
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with Jessica R. and Karl's Catering located at 5100 W. Loomis Road
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Order to Produce for  Plea/Sentencing Hearing on August 25, 2015 @ 8:30am  Received and Filed
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on July 14, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Vincent Mark Williamson not in court, in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter; date selected before Branch 21.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION to include electronic monitoring. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Vincent Mark Williamson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant has obtained private counsel.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
